elements.title: a big duck (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a big duck (pictured) helped promote duck farming on Long Island?

elements.title: Harriette Cooke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Cornell College professor Harriette Cooke was also a deaconess?

elements.title: Luna (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that there were technical issues with the performance of "Luna" by the Colombian singer Feid at the 2024 Copa América opening ceremony?

elements.title: Oey Kim Tiang (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Oey Kim Tiang was one of two "men with no name" to translate Jin Yong's Condor Trilogy into vernacular Malay?

elements.title: the radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the radio station at the University of Wisconsin–Eau Claire would go off the air in the middle of the day?

elements.title: J. D. Arteaga (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that thirty years after playing his first season for the Miami Hurricanes, J. D. Arteaga became the team's head coach in 2024?

elements.title: an African termite (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that scientists tested the age of an African termite's inhabited mound—and found it to be 34,000 years old?

elements.title: Joseph Petzoldt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Albert Einstein wrote to Joseph Petzoldt in 1914 that he had "long shared his convictions", after reading one of his philosophical books?

elements.title: in fiction, supernovae (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in fiction, supernovae are induced to serve as weapons, power sources for time travel, and advertisements?
